And I thought WW84 would scape from the fate of the majority of DC movies ... well this was one doesn't

review_title: Nowhere Near As Bad As The Worst Reviews
review_detailed_main:
Reading the utter carnage of poor reviews for this film, I can only conclude that they were either written by people with an encyclopaedic knowledge of the superhero genre, or by people with no knowledge of it whatsoever. No middle ground. Now, I can understand Comic Book Guy from The Simpsons combing through the minutia and taking grave exception to the film's cliches, apocryphal inconsistencies and general awfulness. But for everyone else, what were you expecting? The character development of Brando from On The Waterfront? A savvy, tightly woven script written by Charlie Kaufman?

In truth, WW1984 requires only as much suspension of disbelief as a swathe of other superhero movies, and doesn't brandish nearly as much plot armour as some other, more highly rated films (Yes, X-Men, I'm looking squarely at you). Before viewing, I was most concerned about how the gimmick of the 1984 time setting would effect the mood of gravitas established by its 2017 predecessor. Would the sequel lapse into bathos, like so many films in the MCU? Because when I think of cheesy, this is scriptwriting straight from the Kraft factory. Maintaining consistency of tone was always going to be a bridge too far, I think, and there are indeed a handful of scenes where the eighties schtick is a bit glitchy. But there's nothing that I found particularly grating...knowing full well how it could have been handled.

So, what did I enjoy about the film? I thought that it was well acted, on the whole. Gal Gadot infuses the WW character with lustre, sincerity and steely resolve. She does a fine job with what is, and must be, a cartoonish script (this is not Citizen Kane, remember). Chris Pine is also very good, and there is no doubting the onscreen chemistry between the two leads (not something to be taken for granted). And I did kinda 'dig' the villain. Pedro Pascal has one hell of a time playing wannabe oil magnate, Max Lord, and at least some attempt was made by the writers to sketch a backstory and endow him with a sense of human fragility. In this respect, I enjoyed him far more than the utterly two dimensional baddie Ludendorff from the first WW film, not to mention David Thewlis's 'ping, I'm actually Ares' moment in the third act (as much as I like Thewlis as an actor).

One more thing to like about WW1984: it's got some really cool aesthetics. The opening 15 minutes, set in Themyscira, is a visual feast and features some compelling cinematography as the camera - virtual or otherwise - swoops and weaves its way around the island as Amazonian athletes strut their stuff. Another well crafted scene involves an admittedly implausible fragment of plot - as Chris Pine flies a 'borrowed' aircraft through an explosion of fireworks en-route to Cairo to save humanity. Ridiculous? Yes. But beautifully shot nonetheless.

Overall, whilst this film certainly ain't no Ironman or Deadpool, it's no Dr Strange either (if we are to speak of totally unearned character development or abuses of logic and physics). I do think that WW1984 is a solid 7, rating it as one must within the genre it is occupying. To lowball the film with ratings of one is really unfair in my opinion. The hyperbolic claims of 'worst film ever' come, I think, from a place of Fanboy-Dom, where unforgivable blasphemies occur and people cheerlead both for and against their favourite franchises. I would recommend the film as no better or worse than a multitude of other superhero movies. Whilst this is hardly high praise, I can honestly say that I thought the film was quite fun, at times moving, with likeable leads and some solid performances. In short, I was entertained.

I haven't laughed so much at a film in ages - So thanks for that!

Other than the awful mall scene, what was the whole point of it being set in the 80s?! There was literally nothing else 80s about the film.

Even American Horror got that bit right

I'd put this film on par with the all female Ghostbusters film - it was that bad

review_title: Watched twice. Still convoluted and disappointing.
Painful to watch, cheesy & bad CGI
review_detailed_main: For such a highly anticipated movie this was one of the biggest letdowns. The cgi was so obvious and overdone and the acting was cheesy. It was a struggle to get through the film. We kept waiting on it to get better, or at least some awesome fight scene, and nothing happened. Seems fitting for the year 2020. They messed up on this one.

review_title: This is great. Worth the watch. Not sure what other reviews are about.
review_detailed_main:
WATCH IT. IGNORE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. I was weary of watching it given the negative reviews on here, but honestly it was a pretty good movie. Sure, it's not as great as the first WW film -- don't go in expecting it to be, but it is still a solid 7/10. Great plot and acting. Be open to enjoying a movie where they build on the characters and not just throw you into 120 minutes of non-stop action. Really makes me sad to see so many angry users on here with unfair reviews of a great movie.

Seriously giving this a 1/10? You've got to be kidding me. You're rating this lower than Dolittle or the Eurovision movie that came out this year??? Hah!!!

I'm not going to give this a 10/10 in hopes of "making up for the low scores" but instead providing an honest review of the film.

Bottomline: If you're interested in the movie and enjoyed the first one and like Gal Gadot, then you will enjoy the sequel.

review_title: Disastrous, boring, confused, poorly played, lacking in common and technical sense flop of a flick

review_detailed_main: There are so many reviews out there giving this movie a bad rating. Let me tell you how they don't understand the movie or the setting of the eighties. This movie has it all. The humor of series like the A team, Macgyver etc. The message of being content with what you have an appreciate it. The simple power of friendliness. Gal Gadot and team you nailed it and don't let others tell you otherwise.
Overall the movie is good. The actions were good the storyline was okay. Both Chris Pine and Gal Gadot has done the great acting. DC can perform well...... After 1hr the actual movie starts......

Is this set in the 80's or not? Hard to tell with the inconsistent set and costumes. Disposable coffee cups like those at a gas station or Starbucks weren't around in that era. Kristen Wiig shines as always.

review_title: This ruined Gal Gadot's charm as Wonder Woman
review_detailed_main: Why why why 2 hrs and 30 minutes, when there is nothing to offer. A family movie made the whole of my family so bored that we had to forward at many parts to just finish the movie. The most disappointing thing is that this movie ruined all of the charm that Gal Gadot had as Wonder Woman. This looked so fake and so bollywood.

review_title: Don't know what the complaints are about...
review_detailed_main: Honestly, the movie was entertaining. It wasn't great, but it was good. The ending felt a bit too easy and cheesy, and overall, the movie had a bit too much of a "feel-good" vibe, but was fun and light-hearted otherwise.
This movie had so much potential and was a complete trainwreck. Might be the worst script and directing job I've ever seen in a movie.

Wonder Woman 1984 is the sequel to the 2017 Wonder Woman. This is a solid sequel, and although the themes are nothing we haven't seen before, it gets its message across and is made well. The film, for the most part, looks great. The entire thing looks like it was shot on film (after a quick google search I confirmed I was right and my eyes are really trained to notice the difference between film and digital now), so the colors look great and the image really pops. The cinematography was pretty solid throughout, although I thought it didn't look the greatest at times.

The film has some CGI that's... bad. A lot of the CGI looks great, but some of it just really doesn't work. The characters are all well written, and the main villain of the film, Maxwell Lord, was really interesting to see. I think he got a little over the top near the end of the film, but he was an interesting villain (a lot better than Ares in the original film...). The movie is entertaining throughout, although I thought some of the action scenes did drag on for a little too long. The score by Hans Zimmer is great, and the film keeps a fast pace and there's never a moment where it drags throughout its two and a half hour runtime. Overall, this is a well written and well made sequel to the original film, and although it has its flaws, I'd definitely recommend seeing it if you liked the first. 7/10.
Nonsense, Mediocre and improvised story and script, lots of loopholes on the storyline, poor performance off absolutely all actors and actress, Oscar to the worst off all DC movies.

"Wonder Woman 1984" is an interesting film with a feeling of the 1970's TV-Series. Many films set in the 1980's looks fake about fashion or furniture, but this film looks like a real 80's film, the costume design and the hairstyles are excellent, even the cinematography is totally retro. Patty Jenkins direction is good, Gal Gadot, Chris Pine and Kristen Wiig performances are great, the production is amazing but the script is weak, some good action and sad scenes, but not more, the special effects are not that cool. A fine film, not a masterpiece but funny, the first film is better than this sequel!

review_title: I renounce my wish of ever seeing this movie!
review_detailed_main: Once you've wasted 2 hours of your life watching this movie you'll wish you listened to all the reviews and hadnt bothered! Some advice, don't waste your time with this drivel!
Not sure why all the bad reviews but I enjoyed this movie.

review_title: Shines as a welcome dose of perfect golden power suited escapism.
review_detailed_main: Jenkins' fast paced direction makes this film an effective comic book movie that leans heavily on wholesomeness and optimism, leaving out any kind of moral ambiguity or nuance for bright colours and popcorn friendly ostentatious action scenes. WW84 is a rare superhero sequel that, for better or rarely worse, carves its own path and finds something joyous, wacky and deeply enjoyable as a result. Gadot has a queenly self-possession and she remains a charismatic presence who wields the lasso with authority. There are some fantastic costumes and some terrific bold performances from a delightful cast specially Pedro Pascal who's talent is being wasted behind the Mandalorian helmet. It's a visually dazzling melodrama that has to hide it's relative disinterest in superpowered showdowns but the movie's in service of a plot that sometimes loses sight of what makes the character so great in the first place. Though the film can't quite reach the heights of the first film, it is still brimming with the same wonder and joy as the previous one beacuse unlike the first the flaws are minor and aren't glaring at you and the movie definitely soars beautifully when it matters the most. Overall, Wonder Woman 1984 is a very hopeful film with hints of sadness and realism especially towards the end and it kinda takes you back into the real world with a much needed message of hope and a sense of optimism, contemplated strongly by the musical score from the legend Hans Zimmer.
I was hoping this would be like the last one but it definitely is not. Seems super low budget and story is average.

review_title: Bad, Boring, and way too long
How does a 200M movie ends up this bad?
Action takes a backseat to the story.
review_detailed_main: More of a morality movie rather than a punch the bad guy in the face movie.

review_title: Not as bad as everyone says, but not a good movie
Maybe don't put the best stuff in the trailer?....

review_detailed_main: Saw it with my family yesterday I still can't get over how epic this movie is.Going in I lowered my expectations because I loved the first one so much but WW84 just surpassed every expectation I had .First of when I heard the villians were gonna be Cheetah and Max Lorde I thought they were a down grade from Aries and not really a threat after defeating a god but boy was I wrong.They totally eclipse the last movies villains as they break down Diana physically and emotionally piece by piece to the point you can just feel sorry her and cry with her .Also the action scenes are beyond epic and are probably some of the best set pieces in comic book history.A Beautyfully crafted film with Themes that is as relevant today as it was in 1984 .My hat goes off to you Patty,Gal and the rest of the cast and crew .Well done I'm pretty sure marvel fans will jump on sites just to give this film bad ratings coz its not made by Disney/Marvel but if they would really just judge films by how good they are everything wont be either black or white

review_title: No, giving just 1 star makes no sense, its not that bad.
review_detailed_main:
But giving it an 8 or 9 star also makes no sense at all. So for me, it is a five at most. Before I watched WW84, I already read some bad reviews, so I was prepared. That helped, that helped a lot. The first Wonder Woman movie was great. For me, that was a 9-star movie.

Don't get me wrong. WW84 had some nice scenes. But also, moments, I just wanted to turn off the movie. My wife stopped watching altogether and instead watch a TV Show. The WW84 mall scene... that hurt. It was a lousy slapstick. The person who designed/wrote that part should be fired and never be allowed to work in the movie or TV industry.

But the bottom line is, would 'I' recommend it? No, but that for you to decide.

In my personal point of view , I think there is an important life advice message that want to show in this film, sound likes : Don't ever expect too much from people, don't always indulge in endless lust, life becomes good as it is, try hard as you can to be better and more valuable, so you pass this mortal life towards god in peace
I think it was okay. I enjoyed 90% of the movie ! Except the third act! And can anyone give me the reason why the CGI is getting worse.

Gal gadot can not act. Full Stop. The script was atrocious, nothing flowed. Best parts of the movie are the supporting cast. And the best 1 minute of this movie was the after credits scene.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

This movie was somehow both typical, and illogical. The main plot was inconsistent, yet reminded me of a lot of DC typical stories. Character development was typical, and the dialogue was cheesy. I could a spilled a box of alphabet soup, and it woulda made a better script.

review_title: Watched It For Gal. The Movie, Hot Dumpster Fire
Gal Gadot deserved a better script. And audience deserved a better movie!

review_detailed_main:
I don't want to think about how much time I donated to the power plant for this thing. I loved the first Wonder Woman movie and had high hopes. They were dashed in minutes.

My advice to the curious: watch until the Smithsonian gala scene. After that it careens so quickly over the cliff that all hopes of landing on a solid story line are lost.

Well i just wasted 2.5 hours of my life on this. Wow how can you make a good movie in the first then with top notch actors in the second be so so bad? I can work out the opening or even fathom why it was there. The rest was slow and disjointed, Pine must of only been there to drag punters in.

For me this came close to the worst comic book film ive ever witnessed but nothing can beat the F4 for that spot, it makes justice league original version a masterpiece. Heres a thing film makers why not actually use the source material properly? You know the reason we like the characters, and not butcher them like this pile of 💩. Please for once leave the stories alone forget esg and write something that will make money.

I think the studios should wait with this movie until the countries open there theaters because yesterday I saw this movie in theaters after I saw it in my home and damn this was nice movie, not what I thought on the movie when I watched it at my home.

...but unfortunately, it's pretty much all down hill from there. The script is poor, the scenery is odd and everything just feels out of place. Gadot is eye-candy and her acting is not too, too bad but that can't make up for the script. Who ever wrote this seems to watched all the old action hero shows from the 70's and 80's and pulled the worst and most wooden parts of the shows and stuck them all in this production. In addition, the ancillary characters too WW are rather poor. Even Chris Pine, who I like in most things, doesn't really fit in the movie. He seems to realize what a stinker he signed up for and kind of, sort of phones in his performance (compared to other roles he's played). There's a reason this made it's appearance in streaming so quickly. So, watch the opening scenes a few times and then just hang it up and call it a night. I wish someone had suggested that to me and I had listened.

A solid sequel, weak but enjoyable storyline. I saw this opening week in the UK, I travelled to my local cinema (34miles one way) to enjoy this film and enjoy it I did. 6 people in the screen including the wife and I. Don't let the headlines of box office flop to put you off, it can't be a success with only 6 people in a 100 seat cinema. The film is what I expected, fantastic effects, good cast, and predictable storyline. In fact for me the storyline was the sticky point, I won't go into details just incase, but the whole first section, it's a shame it bears no impact on the rest of the film or even referred to again. In short, go watch with beer and popcorn, enjoy escape and be happy.

WONDER WOMAN (1984):

When Wonder Woman is the most bland and uninteresting character in her own movie you know its not going to be good. For a movie championing femininity and Girl power, almost all of its better moments came from the male cast aka Chris Pine and Pedro Pascal. Its like a MCU movie without any of the humor, action, quips or even good writing. Just a colorful cheese ride that is one part conflicted nostalgia bait and one part sad romance.

Honestly, Pedro Pascal as a Nicholas Cage-esque Lex Luthor, a time gap Steve, nods to the old TV series and a very special cameo aside it was honestly a poor movie. Even for a sucker for Wonder Woman like me.

RATING: 6/10 (As an obviously biased Wonder Woman fan)
How many times can I fall asleep watching a movie. This was a pathetic excuse for a film and only exists for making money. What a waste of time.

Wonder Woman 1984, directed by Patty Jenkins, significantly underperforms compared to its predecessor, delivering a sequel that lacks the coherence and emotional depth of the original. Despite its vibrant 1980s setting and a promising premise, the film struggles with a convoluted plot, uneven pacing, and underwhelming character development.

The story follows Diana Prince, played by Gal Gadot, living in 1984 Washington, D. C., working at the Smithsonian and performing heroic deeds in secret. The plot centers around the Dreamstone, an artifact that grants wishes but at a significant cost. Diana's wish brings back her deceased lover, Steve Trevor, played by Chris Pine, whose return feels forced and undermines Diana's independence, making him a "masculine crutch" rather than a supportive character like Peggy Carter in the Captain America films.

Gal Gadot continues to shine as Wonder Woman, but even her strong performance cannot save the film from its narrative flaws. The script fails to give Diana the same level of complexity and growth seen in the first film, reducing her to a more passive figure. The return of Chris Pine's Steve Trevor, while charming, dominates the storyline unnecessarily and detracts from Diana's heroism.

Kristen Wiig's portrayal of Barbara Minerva/Cheetah and Pedro Pascal's Maxwell Lord add some intrigue but ultimately fall flat. Wiig's transformation from a meek scientist to a powerful villain is one of the more interesting arcs, but it is rushed and lacks depth. Pascal's Maxwell Lord starts strong but becomes increasingly cartoonish, failing to provide a compelling adversary.

The film's pacing is uneven, with long stretches of exposition and meandering subplots that detract from the main narrative. Key themes about truth and the consequences of wish fulfillment are lost in the cluttered storyline. The over-reliance on CGI, especially in the climactic battle scenes, makes the action feel less grounded and more cartoonish compared to the original.

Visually, the film has its moments, with vibrant colors and some well-executed action sequences, but these are not enough to compensate for the lack of a cohesive and engaging story. The opening sequence featuring a young Diana in an athletic competition is a standout, but nothing else in the film matches its visual cohesion or emotional impact.

Wonder Woman 1984 is a disappointing sequel that fails to capture the magic of the original. The film's convoluted plot, underdeveloped characters, and uneven pacing result in a lackluster viewing experience. While Gal Gadot's performance and the nostalgic 1980s aesthetic provide some highlights, they are not enough to overcome the film's significant weaknesses. Wonder Woman 1984 earns a 4 out of 10 for its missed potential and overall execution, leaving fans yearning for the brilliance of the first film.

It was infantile, ridiculous, and riddled with plot and technical issues. Long, lame dragged out and unnecessary scenes. The dialogue was horrendous. I get that she's a newb writer, but having two other seasoned writers - Geoff Johns and Dave Callaham, there is no excuse for this horrible story. A 5th grader could've written this better.

As an experienced director, she also failed miserably in her direction of the entire 151 minute runtime. Even the great Hans Zimmer's score was too loud, constant and overbearing. Who green-lit this poor excuse of a superhero movie?

Linda Carter must've cringed cashing her cameo paycheck. It's a very generous 3/10 from me, all going to the poor crew that at least came up with some decent S/VFX.

review_title: Not good, but not that bad
review_detailed_main:
There's a lot of excessively harsh reviews here. This movie is just average. It has problems in a few areas, but it isn't worth hating and the visuals and action are fun. It also is clearly having a lot of fun with the period and with fashion, which isn't for everyone.

For my money, among DC films, the trash heap that was Aquaman fully deserved all the 2's and 4's this movie's getting. The fact it currently gets 6.9 is inexplicable to me. It was nonsensical idiocy with no plot or character. WW84 is just clumsily written and directed but at least seems to know what a movie is supposed to be and, y'know, has three discernible acts.

I suspect this movie is getting review bombed because there are obvious parallels to Trump in the male villain. He's a sleazy/trashy conman/businessman who's a loser and a failure and desperately wants more wealth and power and somehow gets it when no one expected it. That said, it's not exactly the story of Trump at each step, it's just taking a character who's similar and telling a morality tale about related themes. But I don't doubt the partisans will take offence.

This movie just really needed more editing (2.5 hours is too long for what they have) and better direction. The logic of the McGuffin at the centre of the story isn't explained very clearly, but withholding the explanation isn't that interesting or exciting, it's actually pretty cliché.

Not being clear about what's happening until way too late in the movie muddles the plot and just makes the hero look incompetent because it's not clear what a disadvantage she's at or why. Either explain the threat almost as soon as the McGuffin is in play and have the hero be really, really weak and in danger or reveal the danger of the McGuffin in the third act after the hero solves the mystery and then have them suddenly in danger from it. But this movie tries to do both and ends up just revealing the threat in dribs and drabs so no one knows how much to care about the threat to the hero, because we have no idea how bad it is.

Maybe they were trying to please everyone and have a strong and capable woman but put her at just enough disadvantage that at times she needed a man's help as well? If so, they just succeeded at pleasing no one. She's not the same model of female empowerment anymore, but the guys who have a problem with female empowerment still aren't going to be satisfied and the vast majority of average viewers who aren't that political are just annoyed they have no idea if she supposed to be powerful or weak in any given scene.

All in all it was entertaining enough that I didn't turn it off, but long and uneven enough that I was checking the runtime around the 2 hour mark.
Movie good. Needed more action, but it was good. Moment with Steve, I felt that. I could see comic fanboys not liking it, but I loved it and so will you!

review_title: Not Great, not horrible... Lots of 80's style cheese
review_detailed_main:
I originally documented this review for Fandango and since I am not up to editing or re-drafting it for IMDB you can just take it for what it is and I adjusted my score based on IMDB

For a sequel I kept my expectations tame. While I didn't find the film to be as good as the first WW, I do find it to be kind of entertaining. As normal Gal Gadot is just stunningly beautiful either as Diana Prince or as WW herself. What I found to be the most amazing aspect of the film was the colors and palette used to create this 1980's style and feel. I think the DP as well as the colorist did a phenomenal job on this film.

One other thing I enjoyed was Steve (Chris Pine) re-discovering the world. The fish out of water element was a nice re-visit with a flipped script since this was done in WW1 with Diana.

Let's face facts it is comic book movie and the cheese level is pretty high on the scale here, but the underlying message about truth is not just fortune cookie wisdom. It actually has much more meaning in a world like our own today in 2020.

Call it what you want? Call it faith, call it Karma this movie was made for a reason not just to fill the taste buds of comic book fans but to make us all look a little deeper at ourselves and ask... Am I really so bad off? and what Truth can I put forth to make myself better.

With all the CGI and hyper over stylized action this movie meets the lust of 80's cheese full on, and while it will not be as memorable as the first WW. It is still a decent entry into the series.

But sit back and appreciate the velveeta fest on display and take the one message the film does deliver.

I chose 4 stars because I felt that the 3 star rating of "Meh... it passed the time" is not a true statement of this film, and I don't think it is awesome by any stretch of the definition of the word. However, it is entertaining and out a scale of 1 to 5 it delivers on the scale at a solid 4.
Avoid at all cost. The storyline is absolutely garbage. The whole cast should be recast. DC continues to disappoint.

Compared to the original movie that made it a surprise hit at the summer box office, this 80s set flick has a confusing plot , bad CGI, and hardly a lot of 80s music against a score that almost sounds like a final fantasy video game.

review_title: Tedious, bloated, and predictable, with some hilarious gaffes
review_detailed_main:
We were so close. 2020, thanks to the COVID epidemic and its effect on film distribution, was very nearly the first year in ages without a single big-studio capesh-t movie, with the exception of Birds of Prey.

But the folk at DC got the idea quicker than Marvel (that online streaming, for better or worse, is the future)), announcing that Wonder Woman 1984 would come straight to HBO Max at Christmas but with a few screenings at the same time - a model set for most of Warner Bros.' other releases going forward (not always with the consent of associated studios, apparently). Time will tell if Marvel will do the same with Black Widow; they clearly aren't shy about putting a gazillion other items on Disney+. Logically, DC must be the real feminists.

If there's one other thing the DC Extended Universe keeps outclassing Marvel on, it's inconsistency - of tone, of style, of lore, the works - and Wonder Woman 2 is no exception. It's downright impressive. Whereas the MCU can only muster up a retcon or two within Captain Marvel and an uncertainty of how many years have truly passed since the "Battle of New York" (a question raised by Spider-Man: Homecoming), DC manage to get something wrong with each new installment. Bravissimo!

Next up to "undo" for the DCEU is a fact established by Batman v Superman and confirmed by the first Wonder Woman film: that Diana "Wonder Woman" Prince went off the grid after World War I, resurfacing only after the Earth's close encounter with Kryptonians. Wonder Woman 1984 decides that "Nah, she actually did some other stuff during the 80s (that no one remembers) and we picked the 80s because Thor: Ragnarok is one of the Marvel films we haven't aped yet, excluding the trippy bits in Aquaman.

But the movie isn't as out-there or charmfully old-fashioned as Ragnarok. We do get some synth tracks, some colorful outfits, and vibrant locations that may be at home in a John Hughes film or a Stranger Things season, but this is still, for the most part, just another modern blockbuster - complete with a misogynistic Trump look-alike, this one being played by a Latino actor in what might be the final jab at Trump. After all, Hollywood soon won't have a Trump to regurgitate their jokes about; in a sense, they already don't.

Maybe Warner Bros wishes they had streamed this film even earlier. Maybe the post-election release of this film made them realize just how much they'll miss this. Watching the ham-tacular Pedro Pascal in WW84 really does feel like the end of an era (not that future movies won't make Trump jokes way past their relevance) and it's a touch bittersweet. I'm sure the point still stands that some things haven't changed since the Reagan years (Pascal's Trump caricature is shown to be in control of the US president of the time) but we all know this sort of satire won't be as fun for Hollywood without a Drumpf, even if it succeeds at seeming "woke", as is always a plus.

But uh-oh, then we have the controversial Egypt scenes, which I've gathered aren't doing wonders for the woke points; critics are irked by the idea of Gal Gadot, an Israeli ex-military celeb garbed in American colors, going to Cairo to set things right and save soccer-playing Arabic children from an incoming missile (that her faction fired but let's no try to sort out all the nonsense). In Kyle Kallgren's words, they "made a scene where a superhero undoes a war crime that the lead actor was likely involved in". So that's pretty funny.

What elevates the movie, in spite of it all, is how likable Gadot's Wonder Woman is - when Gadot's trying. She may be easier to relate to this time around, while retaining the attributes that make her inspiring. She was a demigoddess that became more human; now she's at home among mankind, having to explain modern amenities to a time-traveling Chris Pine (inhabiting the body of someone who gets no say in whether he/they should have sex with Diana).

Still, it's mostly stuff we've seen before - the fish-out-of-water stuff with Pine has been done, the Kristen Wiig character has been done (by Pixar, Marvel, and DC themselves, albeit not always with a furry element), and the ideas surrounding the wish-granting stone have been done (with far more intelligible rules). If it was shorter and more self-aware, I'm sure I wouldn't mind. As it stands, it is a weak film that some of you might have fun with anyway, especially during its idiotic, hideous, sloppily produced action moments.

And no matter how hard you insist that this is a comic-book movie and so it isn't meant to be taken that seriously (despite the insisted poignancy and emotional weight of several scenes), nor be realistic, Diana Prince "swinging" on lightning bolts with her whip isn't going to look non-stupid. "It's meant to look cool, though", someone might say, and the fact that it goes for coolness at the expense of rudimentary realism is what makes it so goofy.

I'm sure there is a possibility she's being helped by her pep-pep Zeus during these moments but that only reminds me of the sad fact that, should Zeus ever appear in the DCEU, we won't get to see a mythologically accurate love life.

Wonder Woman 1984 is a decent sequel to Wonder Woman!! It has solid acting from the cast, and Gal Gadot delivers her best performance as the iconic heroine yet! Pedro Pascal is a marvelous antagonist in the form of Maxwell Lord. The action sequences are cool to watch when there are any. The villains here are much better than Ares from the first movie, and WW84 has a superior third act to its predecessor. This movie has some great humor, and it never fails to make you laugh when needed. The emotional moments in WW84 are so heartbreaking to watch, it never fails to make the audience cry, or shed a tear. The story here is good, but it drags midway through the movie, and it's not as good as it could've been. The pacing was all over the place, something that bothered me in the movie. Overall, it's a step down from the first movie, but it's not bad like people make it out to be!! P.S. Stay for the credits, it'll be worth it!!

review_title: A huge quality drop off from the first film, a major letdown!
review_detailed_main:
Lets not kid ourselves, 2017's Wonder Woman was no cinematic classic but when compared to this second outing, the 2017 Gal Gadot starring and Patty Jenkin's directed hit looks like the Citizen Kane of superhero films.

A surprisingly fun and inventive offering, the first WW came at the ideal time for the struggling DC cinematic universe and in turn launched its leading lady and director into the public eye in a big way, with many fans from across the globe keen to see where the adventures of Diana Prince would lead to next.

Ensuring that we all understand wishes shouldn't always come true (a key theme to one of the films incredibly overwrought and cringe plot-lines), the return of the WW gang comes as one of the nastiest surprises of the 2020 release calendar as the first films charm and playfulness is replaced with a dreary, overlong and lifeless blockbuster that fails in almost every single way as it tries to recapture the lightning in a bottle vibe the original managed to harness.

It's one of the biggest drop off's in quality seen in a sequel in some years, gone is the charm of Gadot who appears to be laboring with the material she's given, Jenkin's is unable to capture any magic with set pieces or character beats and the films 80's infused humor and throwbacks is nothing more than a waste of time, with one left wondering why on earth the film even needed to be set in the 80's outside of the fact it was trying to piggyback off the era's popularity in pop culture right at this moment.

From the instant we witness Prince swinging around a local mall in the films awkward opening stand you get a feeling something isn't quite right in WW world but there remains hope things can only pick up from here on out but with a laborious 40 minute or so stretch that follows, that allocates far too much time to Kristin Wiig's Barbara Minerva and the Raspberry Award seeking Pedro Pascal as oil tycoon Maxwell Lord (legitimately one of the worst comic book villains committed to celluloid with a performance that is all-time bad), you quickly begin to realize that 1984 has been doomed to fail.

If one were to waste their precious time or somehow manage to endure multiple screenings of this cringe-worthy affair there could be thousands of words written about the lameness that is to follow on in the wake of 1984's mismanaged opening segments with countless plot holes and eye-rolling moments (fueled up museum planes, 4th of July fireworks, kids playing soccer on a highway etc etc) building and building until you're willing the film to put and end to this whole shebang as its tigertastic final battle and preachy messages of love and kindness take hold around an overwrought final act, one that I'm sure its screenwriters were gleeful with as their life affirming messages found themselves proudly attached to one of recent memories worst finales.

Throughout the film you're given moments that remind you that everything at one stage appeared to point to WW being a likeable and fun cinematic property, Gadot and the returning Chris Pine still share a good on screen chemistry even if there reunion is clouded in a seriously odd set of creepy circumstances and a throwback to the island of Prince's youth is fun and over the top with Hans Zimmer's typically intense score perfectly encapsulating proceedings but all you're left with as the credits begin to roll is a feeling that WW may never properly recover from the misguided failings of this Xmas turkey.

Final Say -

There's an incredible amount of things wrong with Wonder Woman 1984, a preachy, over the top and uninviting escapade that is far too long and self-confident for its own good. We may never know how things turned so bad from something originally so promising, as its now unlikely we will ever again see the Diana Prince and her adventures we all feel in love with back in 2017.

1 1/2 wishes out of 5

review_title: WW84 is an underrated and different superhero film, but the character driven plot fits Wonder Woman
review_detailed_main:
Wonder Woman 1984 is the second installment in Patty Jenkins' Wonder Woman trilogy. It's very much her movie as she co-wrote the script with Geoff Johns and Dave Callahan, she also directed and produced the movie.

Patty Jenkins is a great director, she showed it with the first Wonder Woman and of course her award winning Monster. I have read multiple reviews that WM84 isn't a good film but I disagree, it's different and not the average superhero film and I'm glad Patty Jenkins and her team made it a character driven film and not about a dark versus light. Instead it's more about the characters and about greed, I found the pacing to be perfect for the character driven story. The overall writing was great, maybe a few things could be improved but I liked it.

The first installment took place in 1918, and the sequel finds Diana Prince at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D. C while secretly performing heroic deeds as Wonder Woman. It have been 66 years and in that time she have grown wiser and more mature, also learning new powers and mastering old.

Wonder Woman 1984 is much more character driven than the previous film and I'm fine with that, the characters are well written and rightfully cast, great acting from everyone. It's extremely light in tone and the stages in life that Diana/WM is believable and I appreciate a movie like WW84 and Shazam to be this lighthearted. Wonder Woman is truly a hero in this film, saving countless of lives and honestly not hurting a single person. It says says a lot of a person, but she isn't perfect and nor is the other main characters, everyone has flaws and that's why they are realistic and likeable.

Pedro Pascal portrays Maxwell "Max Lord" Lorenzano, he's a struggling yet charismatic businessman who are famous for TV infomercials, and the founder of Black Gold Cooperative. After spending the majority of his life searching for the mythical Dreamstone, Lord acquires it and uses it for power and personal gain. What you'll see and notice about the film and the story its trying to tell is that it's about greed, fitting then as it is now.

Kristen Wiig portrays Barbara Minerva / Cheetah who are an insecure geologist and gemologist who befriends Diana before becoming imbued with mystical abilities that gradually transform her into an apex predator-like superhuman, Cheetah. Seeing Kristen as Cheetah was one of the highlights, she was perfect for the role and made the character justice.

Chris Pine returns as Steve Trevor and it was everything I wanted for the character, I'm glad he could come back. Great performance.

The fight sequences aren't bad, they just aren't exciting and engaging enough. I want to say this though, I have respect and appreciate the work Patty Jenkins placed into the action sequences and lack of violence, it fits with Wonder Woman and the tone of the movie completely. What I love with the action sequences are the choreography and the use of Wonder Woman's powers and skills, Gal Gadot is amazing.

Matthew Jenson was the director of photography and he's an acclaimed cinematographer, his work in this film doesn't go unnoticed. The cinematography is incredible and one of the highlights of the movie, as it's so pleasant for your eyes.

The musical score by Hans Zimmer is hopeful, powerful and brilliant. Perfect return to the superhero genre.

Some final thoughts about the ending, no spoilers. I found the ending to be perfect, and I'm so glad there weren't a cgi boss that Wonder Woman needed to beat as that would have destroyed the themes and tone of the movie, it's the one thing I disliked about the first film, how there had to be a cgi boss battle. The ending was perfect and they have set up some very nice things for the third installment, I hope Patty Jenkins brings in Donna Troy as a new character.

I mean, guys, this movie had a proposal at the beginning: make us swollow down girl power. Ok, I don't like this kind of stuff because everybody has the right to be what they want to be and I don't need a movie to show me that. But at least it had a point at the beginning, and I was ready to take it.

But as the plot goes on, the movie becomes boring, with empty attempts of comic relief, and worse, it felt like the director took vacation and let everyone take decisions. Seams Patty Jenkins told the actors "you are great actors, act like you'd want to". So the VFX supervisors took her exemple and let the VFX team do what they pleased: No sense good-looking CGI (I don't even know that could exist such thing).

There was a time the movie started giving me too much information, too much supernatural rules like a very bad RPG master who wants to fill up the story.

I WON'T EVEN SAY ABOUT WRITING MISS JENKINS & GEOFF JOHNS!!!

In short, it's a miserable fail with a big potential. I had everything to redeem the first movie, but writers and director couldn't deliver it. I KNOW there's the fact of COVID-19 and all, but I won't refresh on my opinion. It's sad how a full star production could be so misused.

I feel sad about Chris Pine, Kristen Wiig and Pedro Pascal who are great actors. I feel sad specially for Gal Gadot who took part on the production in addition of being a phenomenal artist. This movie was a disrespect for the main acting team's career.

review_title: Don't overthink things... comic book fans will love
review_detailed_main: If you ever read the comics, you'll love this movie. Seeing Cheetah played on the big screen was awesome. Yes there are some times the CG doesn't keep up. The pace of the movie seems like there are moments where things aren't explained and others where things are overextended/over explained. But to sit back and watch Gal Gadot in her WW role is amazing. Chris Pine as Steve is exactly how you want him. Handsome, cynical, and ready to defend the one woman who has his heart. Kristen Wiig truly captured the essence of Cheetah and her insecurities. I wish there were more of her and Diana to really show the comic book side of things. But..Pedro Pascal was loving playing Max Lord and it came through. Overall is was truly a great movie. Already watching again... DO WATCH THE END CREDITS!!! It's sooo worth it!! I was jumping up n down seeing my childhood WW show up! Ready to watch again.

review_title: Embarassing soap opera with shallow self help and awful script
review_detailed_main: In the first 11 minutes, we see a child Diana having a great performance in a kind of Olympic Games of Amazons. Well, that was promising enough... Then, things change and we see for five minites adult Wonder Woman saving the they in a shopping mall. Despite some nonsense action scenes with the lasso, it seemed that the movie would have a vintage old-school superhero approach, what could also be very interesting. However, after that, the real film began as what it would be until the end: an embarassing and silly soap opera with poor script, a lot pf shallow self-help and inconsistent superpowers and magic. While both villains are ridiculous, the idea of Diana's dead lover possessing another man was even much worse! Script is not only cheesy as the worst cliché romantic comedies, but also quite lazy, as the evil rock of desires makes obvious. Cheetah's uprising, the invisible plane... everything had a bad and unintelligent explanation in the story, or simply was not explained, such as the weird flight (was that Supergirl?! Is that Hawkgirl?! I thought it was a Wonder Moman movie!). To resume: awful blockbuster. Gal Gadot also looks better when she is in superpower action full of CGI than when she is actually acting.

review_title: Poorly drawn characters and incoherent storytelling results in 150 interminable minutes

review_detailed_main:
Unfortunately this film probably won't live up to most viewers expectations. The first Wonder Woman film set a precedent, and actually had something fresh to say. WW84 feels like a sequel that had to be made, to capitalize on the huge box office of the previous film, even though there was no more story to tell.

Also, was there really any reason for this movie to take place in 1984? Other than trying to capitalize on 80s nostalgia, this movie's story could have happened at any time. The only link I can see, is this movie had a campy feel, similar to the Superman sequels of the mid-80s.

review_title: Worst movie I have paid for in a while!
review_detailed_main: No real story. All over the place. Boring. I wish I burned my eyes out before watching this dumpster fire. I can't unsee it! My wife and I love movies. We talked about it all the way home and neither of us could think of anything good to say. The pandemic has nothing on this movie!!! Awful! I wish I could give negatve stars.

review_title: Don't understand the hate this one is getting - perfectly fine Wonder Woman movie
review_detailed_main:
I must say I was somewhat tiptoeing in to seeing this and grabbed it when iTunes has a special short-time price. Overall - I gotta say I don't get the hate here - this cannot be over the movie.

That a relic from the gods is found and wrecks havoc, demanding hard choices and sacrifices to overcome the challenges and save the day - that is core Wonder Woman stuff.

I was happy to see Chris Pine return, even in a roundabout way, as he and Gal Gadot has absolute perfect on-screen chemistry and just seem to bounce off each other like choreographed.

And their relationship also is a great vehicle for exploring the absolute core of Wonder Woman - and perhaps that is what is throwing people off here; this is not another movie of Wonder Woman kicking ass, but rather finally facing up to having locked herself away from the world and what it is costing here - there are some serious leaps of growth as a character and I certainly hope to see Gal Gadot return to this role; albeit, I would appreciate a third movie with some more omph! :)

The ending of Max Lord is perhaps the weakest point in this movie - without spoiling everything, I think he gets away too easy, that feels definitely unsatisfying.

review_title: Resembles a made for tv children's movie
review_detailed_main: What a joke of a movie 2/10 . It was like watching a made for TV children's movie from the 90s, bad editing, bad CGI, bad script, and the Plot was RIDICULOUS.

review_title: Not great but not deserving of the bad reviews
review_detailed_main:
Maybe it's because I'm biased, I admit that I've been a DC comics fan (and it's movies/TV shows based off of their characters) since the 70s. Running home from elementary school to watch Batman with Adam West and waking up early Saturday morning to watch Superman George Reeve. When the Wonder Woman TV show with Linda Carter aired, I was all in and one of the privileged that saw Christopher Reeves wear the red cape with blue suit.

Overall my opinion regarding the DCEU has been mixed, I didn't like Man of Steel as much as the movies from my youth, a "darker" Superman just doesn't sit as well with me as the darker Batman does but the attempt to remain faithful to the original look and feel of Krypton was enough for me to look past it. I enjoyed Wonder Woman but didn't much like the WWI setting because it's contrary to the origin story, but suspect that it was in large part to set it apart from the recently released Marvel superhero movie set in the same timeframe, so again, it was enough to get me to look past it.

I genuinely like this movie, plot is new and fresh along with injecting a deeper moral tale to not take short cuts because when you do it will cause you problems down the line. Admittedly, most of my knowledge about Wonder Woman is based off of the 70s tv show and the animated Saturday morning Superfriends or DC animated cartoons of recent years so I'll need to defer to my DC comics colleagues with more knowledge of the source material to provide accuracy details in that department.

I do think it's a decent entry into the DCEU franchise and moving it into it's current direction, which overall I agree with. Aquaman and Shazam both fits nicely in this continuity and soft reboot direction. Action is good, special effects could be better but not distracting and acting is consistent with the previous movie. Not getting the "Trump" reference I'm reading in other reviews, but truth is that I put the blame for those criticisms on Hollywood and professional reviewers, not on the individuals who are seeing it. Far too often Hollywood and professional Journalists inject so much political b.s. into the movies that if you see an African American actor playing President it's just assumed that it reflects how that producer views Obama and now if you see a blond funky comb over it's assumed to be Trump. Hollywood and Journalists both need to get a grip and return to Earth.

If you liked the previous Wonder Woman film or the Aquaman and Shazam movies, you'll like this as well. Again, not as solid, but a good follow-up to the Amazon princess.
Everything that makes a movie terrible. Slept 10 hours before watching this and this film put me right back to sleep. Also, a lot of pot holes

review_title: Worth it in the year of Covid
review_detailed_main: One needs some positivity this year. Yes the movie is long winded. Yes there are flaws. But we can all do with some cheer. Overall, the movie works. Especially love the focus on relationships which often lacks in superhero movies.

review_title: Not great, but still a decent film.
review_detailed_main: This film doesn't deserve so much backlash as to be fair I've seen worst films and this isn't one of them. Some scenes were better than others, but it's still a decent film and got a pass from me.

I was looking forward to seeing this, but I was more than disappointed. The script of this movie is the most atrocious thing I have ever seen. I will briefly review the storyline so that spoilers are not present.

Opening scene: (shown in ads, so not a spoiler) Wonder Woman's early years in a competition. Completely unrealistic that she is beating adult women in an olympic thing complete with horse racing and parkour. Then it turns into a goofy moral filled ending of the competition. You are wanting more of her early life story, but then it skips right to adulthood.

The problem with the rest of the movie is that it has ridiculous amounts of filler. It will spend 10 minutes straight acting as if the main pot line is not there. Stupid things like the mall scene, attacker scene, love story scene, etc. It is like lots of small cut scene movies chopped together. Then you got Pedro Pascal doing the main plot line of the movie the whole time. Pedro is simply not a good villain. It is so laughably bad, but they dragged the movie on for days. It's as if 3 separate movies were made about each main/supporting character and they pieced them together in the editing room. The action scenes randomly appear in the movie, but then they quickly end and go back to the random story lines.

review_title: 5 years + 200 million dollars = a horrible movie?
review_detailed_main: This movie should've had audiences cheering! There's just no excuse for how much of a mess this entire movie was. It's Wonder Woman, it's colorful, its the 80's, it cost a fortune - so why is this movie no fun? Unfortunately, it's just bad, uninspired storytelling.

I thought that the first Wonder Woman was bad, but was I ever wrong.

WW84 is just God-awful. I'm sorry.... I just don't even want to think about it any longer.

review_title: One of the worst films ever made
review_detailed_main:
Nothing about this film worked. Complete disaster. Loved the first one none of the magic of that film made it to the sequel.

The 80's look fell flat, characters and dialogue as well. Action sequences looked fake or just dumb. How did such a pile of garbage get made?

I feel bad for all the talented people that had to get on this crazy train. Poor Chris Pine can't get a break great Kirk and Jack Ryan but both franchises fizzled out. Now he is part of yet another failing brand.

review_title: Need the opposite of a directors cut
review_detailed_main: Really enjoyed the film. Pedro and Gal steal every scene and Chris and Kristen have great supporting roles. Only issue is they wanted too much and should have shortened it by 30 minutes. Especially since I was at home watching release day some of the longer scenes got me looking at my phone. Acting was great. Liked the story honestly. Just tooooo drawn out at times.

I've decided to sign in for this movie. It was so bad. I lasted whole 10 minutes. Even my kids were bored and I was jist disgusted. I can't believe that such a bad movie is alloud to release. There shouldnbe some commission cancelling such a pointless brain washing peace of ...

review_title: With all the senseless ranting negatives, here are what's good about story of WW84
review_detailed_main:
Look everywhere you see nothing but plethora of 1 star reviews, ranting, complaining and just really boring and non-intelligent rambling.

I don't disagree to majority of the complaint but they're not to the intensity of deserving a 1 star review, a more appropriate be a 6 or 7 stars.

What's good about the story of WW84? There are lots actually.

1. I love how the movie explore the aspect of an inner demon, which is ourselves and our desires and wants. Ancient teachers have taught us that to seek answers, look within and to Know Thyself. Why? Because we are our greatest enemies.

This movie explore the danger of our desires and the harm we unknowingly can hurt our close friends and love ones. I thought this movie is awesome in that regard!

WW84 truly lives to the feminine aspect of looking inward to ourselves, are we truly honest with our selves? Or are we pretending to be someone else we're not just because of fear or ridicule or what others may think? WW84 is an amazing movie to explorer such depth that not few Hollywood movies today do.

And WHY AM I THE ONLY WHO SPEAKS OUT ABOUT THIS? I'm sure there are supporters and fans who may be too afraid to speak when they see plethora of negativity.

WELL YOU SHOULD ALWAYS DO THE OPPOSITE when you see majority of the "herd mentality" like feral pack animals going in one direction, SMACK THE S out of THEM and wake them up. Tell them they are not the Borg, they are not ONE MIND being programmed like zombies and RESISTANCE IS FUTILE is a lie because RESISTANCE always beings about PROGRESS. LOL.

2. There are many positives but I'll just make 2. The solution to our world's biggest problems sometimes DO NOT rely on an single INDIVIDUAL or a single HERO or HEROINE. The greatest message WW84 gives me to and I'm sure millions of fans out there is this MESSAGE - YOU AS AN INDIVIDUAL, you may see yourself as just one person and that your thoughts, your actions DO NOT matter. But WW84 is here to tell you, you as an individual - without super powers - your thoughts and actions -DO MATTER!!! Collectively billions of minds added together, if we all believe OUR thoughts, OUR actions matter, then combined the POWER is greater than any single HERO or HEROINE can do. Also WW84 is also trying to say - that LEADERS and HERO/HEROINE greatest task is to EMPOWER the individuals that their voice, their vote matters. That their thoughts and actions matters.

Just these 2 points along makes WW84 a GREAT movie. Plus what's not to like about the beautiful Gal Gadot? The golden armor is just spectacular - really love it. Like Nephilim or Cherubim, the golden arc wings of angelic being of high heavens. Ah - so majestic and beautiful AND powerful.

Think positive guys/gals - for the world need positive thinkers to push society forward.

The long anticipated "WW84" is finally with us on the big screen and small screen no less, after numerous delays due to the coronavirus we can all finally enjoy seeing DC's blockbuster. But how does it stack up? Well, it's a bit of a mixed bag (but in the best way)! Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot return and it's no secret that they know what they're doing, Gadot has shined from the moment she stepped foot into Wonder Woman's boots and Jenkins clearly has a love for the character (not to mention a talent for directing), aside from Gadot, everyone acting in this film is on their A-Game. Chris Pine returns and continues his wonderful chemistry with Gadot, while newcomers Pedro Pascal and Kristen Wiig are just performing their hearts out and clearly having a great time. The 80's setting is also a welcome addition, I tend to be a sucker for this period in film and this was no exception. So the acting is great, the direction phenomenal, and the setting fun and colorful. What's the problem? Sadly, the script. While I feel like this movie captures Wonder Woman's spirit it's sadly not very well written. The plot can at times feel zany which is not a problem as it is a superhero film, but the dialogue doesn't help the fact. The entire film feels reminiscent to the 90s Batman movies (With Kristen Wiig's character clearly taking on the Poison Ivy/Riddler role). I wouldn't complain so much but this is coming off the heels of a spectacular first film and that script was actually quite good in terms of story and plot. While one could argue WWI is a darker tone than 1984, it just feels like this movie has a lot going on and the way they speak doesn't I can't keep a straight face. At the end of the day, this is a fun and inviting sequel to its predecessor that has great performances and phenomenal visuals, even if at times it can feel a bit bloated and strange to listen to. I'd gladly watch this film again, but I'd be lying if I admitted the first wasn't better. Also stay tuned for the after credits, for quite a fun surprise.
I don't even have the energy to write this review. I just wish I could get the 2 hours of my life that I lost to this nonsense.

review_title: How to destroy a Super Hero, even though she beat her opponent
review_detailed_main: Silly and cringeworthy lines that probably took all the actors' talent to keep them watchable, certain periods of mediocre acting and hundreds of plotholes when it comes to the scenario and the action scenes, the super powers etc. I won't repeat what has been stated probably hundreds of times before here. Really bad effort, Wonder Woman probably wonders how this left the production stage...

review_title: Not a masterpiece, but not as bad as people are saying
review_detailed_main: I really think 2020 has just turned everyone into pessimistic bafoons. Can people not just enjoy a movie anymore? Does everything have to be a cinematic masterpiece? I literally keep reading reviews picking apart the 'reality' of a superhero movie!! They are freaking superheros!! What part of that made you think 'hmmm... this movie should be completely realistic to real life'??? Turn off your pessimism and enjoy the damn movie. I always thought that the first movie was a bit overrated, I liked it, but everyone was going gaga over it. I don't think this movie was one bit better or worse than the first one, I actually thought this one had a better villain. Yes, it's full of self righteousness and yes the opening mall scene was very cheezy, but overall I enjoyed it for what it was and I don't think it makes me feel any better or worse about the franchise as a whole.
Bad movie. Graphics, story and production are worst than the previous one.

review_title: Great escape! WW remains the best!

review_detailed_main: I enjoyed the first movie. Gal Gadot is excellent as the golden hearted heroine in both films and is 3 of the 3 stars I gave for this stinker. Wow, what a lame story- just to crowbar in you know who it seems- why isn't someone somewhere saying no, this is rubbish! before it even gets off the ground? They tried to take what was good from the first movie but just ended up producing some crappy cheap fast-food version. McWonder Woman. I feel sorry for the actors. I remember seeing the main bad guy in the Buffy the Vampire Slayer series. So this jobbing actor gets a big-break in a blockbuster movie scenario and it's this one. Really not worth your time, watch something else.

review_title: I've seen better, but it wasn't THAT bad
review_detailed_main: This Movie wasn't brilliant, but it wasn't as bad as some of these reviews are saying it is. I will admit, there are some very cheesy moments, and at one point, I was thinking "ok something needs to happen now". But it wasn't a terrible movie. Some of the action scenes were good. Not brilliant, but good. I actually liked the female villain, but she would have been so much better if she was an Apex predator from the beginning. Instead, they decided to add a bit of dark eye make up and longer hair to make the character look stronger, and edgier. meh. just make them fight already! I wouldn't recommend paying for it. but give it a watch. Its not THAT bad.

review_title: A bad film to watch even during quarantine
review_detailed_main: This film is so inept that it's a truly waste of time to watch it even while doing quarantine. Very badly written, slow, just a few action scenes, ridiculous characters, lack of depths, things that just don't add up. The first hour feels like two.... There's nothing here worth watching. Maybe just the beauty of Gal Gadot. Terrible sequel to a promising first franchise film.

review_title: A smile lights up the screen
review_detailed_main:
The film seemed very good to me, although not excellent. The narrative may seem a bit slow, but necessary. Gal Gadot perfect in her role, the expressions on her face and the physical strength she shows, are totally believable. The movie has a good pace, but it could last 15 minutes less and no sequence of the story would be missed.

What I liked the most, obviously, the protagonist, with that smile that floods the screen, and makes the rest stop mattering. It's worth it, enjoy it.

review_title: Not as bad as they say...
Turns out wonder woman is a rapist
Too much on the plate, even for 2 hours 35 minutes
A fairly standard superhero film that doesn't lean into much of its era or characters.
Unless WW3 is written and directed by William Moulton Marston and H.G. Peter, I'll skip it..
review_detailed_main: I will settle for Zack Synder. After seeing WW1984 tonight, I will never watch anything with Patty Jenkins' name on it. Pedro Pascal is awful. He was awful in Kingsman 2 and he's a cringeworthy cartoonish mess in WW1984. A good director would have reigned him in. Please keep Prince Oberyn out of movies. If we want to see Kristen Wiig, we'll rewatch Bridesmaids. Hollywood, please stop casting Kristen Wiig. She is badly miscast in WW1984. She looks uncomfortable and lost. Please Stop Resurrecting Steve Trevor. Gal Gadot is a very likeable, gorgeous, strong lead. She deserved a better movie, not this overindulgent, bloated, chaotic mess. Wow, it was unbelievably bad
Really bad story, plot, writing; no point going any further than that. First four minutes was the best part, no wonder they used as a teaser. The movie was doomed after that due to the script.

review_title: Too much talking, not enough action!
review_detailed_main: To make my review simple, my problem was there wasn't enough action. I usually love dialogue and I critique movies for not having enough of it but in this case, there was way too much talking. To make matters worse, the dialogue wasn't all that engaging. I just don't think every thing needed to be explained, we the viewers can get messages through the actions of characters. I adore Gal Gadot and I think Gal did a solid job as Wonder Woman. She embodies the principles of Diana Prince. I loved most of the action sequences in the movie but they were too far and too few. I can only speak for myself but when I watch a superhero movie I want to see the superhero using their powers most of the time and it wasn't enough of that in this movie. With all this said I really hope to see a third film. As I said before I like Gal and I think she does a good job as Wonder Woman so I have faith, with better material she can deliver an amazing performance.
How can the first one be so good, and this one so bad. Yeah, I wanted to walk out on it but I watched it at home.

review_title: Very good sequel, but missing something.
review_detailed_main: It was a very good movie. For me, it came very close to the first one, but it was missing something. Still overall I think Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot did a fantastic job with a sequel full of heart, humor and awesome action. It also has a very great message about wishing. I also thought the villains of the movie were very well done. Pedro Pascal and Kristen Wiig were very good as Maxwell Lord and Barbara/Ceetah. So I really recommand it if you loved or liked the first one.

review_title: A good one-time watch. Don't listen to those giving 1 star rating!
review_detailed_main: Movie was a decent watch, a bit lengthy, but acting is good and gal gadot looks gorgeous as always. Logic is out of question as in most superhero movies. Ut it's not bad at all. Looks like a planned mass voting of 1-2 ratings by DC's competitors.

The writing was that of a fourth grader's school assembly. The design was absent from the story. The story made no sense in any way whatsoever. It was so long. So so very long. These were good actors giving the worst performances. The editors and director should be apologizing to the actors for choosing these takes. The concept was dumb and inconsistent. The extras felt like they were told to ham it up. It held up every awful stereotype. The relationships felt like most of the people met that day, and were uncomfortable around each other. It was not even fun. It had a couple of decent nonsensical action scenes, but the constant shift in her powers, and the overuse of the lasso were unflattering. I am embarrassed for everyone involved in the decision making for this film. The first movie was so good - and this was no just a bad sequel, but the worst superhero movie I have ever seen - and I have seen almost all of them. I often get accused of being too easy on certain films. I would maintain, the above is STILL going easy on this film. Horrendous on every level.

review_title: Honestly created an account just to warn to others
review_detailed_main: My kids couldn't watch the entirety of this movie, two of them wandered off mid movie! Spend your money somewhere else, wish I could get a refund.

I mean, there is no doubt Pedro Pascal is a brilliant actor. Or atleast in my opinion. The screenwriting is just lazy, the CGI is not in the standard of a DC movie, character development... meh. I just feel like this movie would've been great but just not as a Wonder Woman movie. Maybe another scenario where the concept of this movie happens (there is one by the way called Absolutely Anything (2015) ). I feel like Pedro Pascal dominated the entire movie with his acting and his perfect screen time. If you are looking for something out of the comics, don't. If you want to waste time, yeah maybe why not. You get bored time to time with very little action throughout the movie.

review_title: Since y'all can't actually be bothered to write a real review..
review_detailed_main:
So this movie isn't anything special. I usually don't write reviews for films that are neither terrible nor great, but looking at all the "reviews" here, it's a little disgraceful that no one can seem to actually articulate a complete thought about it.

Yes, this did feel rather cheap compared to the first movie. The effects and overall production just felt a little shoddy. There are parts where Gadot is swinging from her lasso where it looked like circa-1984 green screen work.

The writing is kind of a mess and doesn't feel very inspired. We just kind of skip from one thing to another and there's little cohesion from scene to scene. There are a lot of obviously unlikely or impossible things happening without any attempt to justify them. Yes, this is kind of typical of a lot of movies, but here it's so unabashed and they're not even trying to employ misdirection or anything to make it less obvious.

I would say overall it does manage to be at least a little entertaining though. Pedro Pascal and Kristen Wiig are the stand-outs here. I think both do a good job with what they're given. Yes, the acting overall in the film is a little substandard, but I wouldn't say there are no redeeming performances.

So, yeah, this was a little bit of a disappointment after the first film (which wasn't perfect either), but I think the poorly-expressed vitriol you see being directed at it is rather hyperbolic.

review_title: Probably the worst modern superhero movie

review_detailed_main: This is a solid movie, had a very great 80's feel to it. Reminded me of the Richard Donner Superman movies. Beautiful in 4K, stunning color. Pedro Pascal acted his heart out and Kristen Wiig did well as Cheetah. I watched it 3 times....

Outside of the opening, this is one of the worst movies I've seen in a long time. Gadot and Wiig are both beautiful strong women that are wonderful talents but even they have to have a plot to work within. This movie is a train wreck ten minutes in to finish. Just terrible.

I understand the negativity spreading around this movie, less action, long movie and all. But I enjoyed it very much, its a not regular routine type of super hero movie, this carries a very strong message and also it shows how a hero can make difference through their words and good deeds, the actual meaning of a hero. Yes this doesn't stand upto to part 1 and didn't connect emotionally as much it did in the last act of its predecessor. Having said that this definitely a good movie, children will love it and learn from it as well. Trust me this will get more praises when times passes. Yes the action could have been a lot better, the over usage of Laso of truth was bummer.
Most of the budget went to the Gadot and her makeup. Special effects at the level of the 2000s. The plot is just terrible. This is the final of Gadot's career.

review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
review_detailed_main:
2 1/2 hours of complete garbage. It was boring and slow, the few times there was any action it was poorly executed and the CGI isn't good at all.

I find it ironic that I scrolled the reviews for 5 minutes and saw nothing above a 3 star rating yet this movie still has a 6.

review_title: I think my aspirations is so high

review_detailed_main: Worth the watch, great sequel. I liked it better than the first
Cast were not engaging, weak actors. I am sure with a few major changes in Cast this can be a sustainable franchise, otherwise in my opinion it will no go anywhere.

review_title: Let's go to the 80s with Wonder Woman

review_detailed_main: This movie could easily lose half an hour or more, but that wouldn't help very much, the main story is ok, but the writing is quite inconsistent and the pace is terrible, after the first action scene the movie drags over one hour showing long, silly and boring scenes of the character coming and going, doing nothing. When the main events unfold, it's quite a mess, and the characters keep running around like headless chicken. The action is not impressive, nothing new to see. Many things don't make any sense and I don't even want to start thinking about plotholes... Quite a mess of a movie, it does have some good moments, but it's definitely not a good movie.

review_title: Life is good, but it can be better
review_detailed_main:
Gal Gadot and Patty Jenkis return for the sequel to "Wonder Woman". It was one of the thousands of films that were advanced because of the Pandemic, but fortunately it was released in 2020, even with controversy, as it will be simultaneous with streaming, something new for the industry.

Gal Gadot manages to act and stand out here than in the first film. The two villains are well developed, the story of the two holds you back. The sequel is better than the first film. Well, here it is lighter, upward, high spirits, even with the problems that the humanity of the film faces, and we also in real life, the film brings a speech of optimism and hope. Inspiring us to be better as humanity!

It has the '80s vibe, but with the look, technologies and ambitions of the time. But, I missed the songs of the time, which was the best time to have a soundtrack. In the trailers, they put "New Order - Blue Monday" and it was one of the things that took me to see the movie.

It also has fan service and references according to the mythology of the heroine in the comics. And that post-credits scene was sensational, it made me tear up and vibrate, and look, I didn't even accompany this person in her time!

Weaknesses - Drafty plot, the story should be better carved. Acting didn't add much to the mix. Strongs - Good, important, message. A certain level of eloquence was achieved. In the end, it wasn't a waste of time.
